full_product_name.product_name: cups-1:2.2.6-38.el8 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream (v. 8)
cups-1:2.2.6-38.el8 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux BaseOS (v. 8)

notes.note: cups: heap based buffer overflow in libcups's ppdFindOption() in ppd-mark.c

reference.description: bz#1823964: CVE-2020-3898 cups: heap based buffer overflow in libcups's ppdFindOption() in ppd-mark.c

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
After installing this update, the cupsd service will be restarted automatically.

acknowledgment.description: Red Hat would like to thank Apple Product Security for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Stephan Zeisberg (Security Research Labs) as the original reporter.

note:
An update for cups is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Low. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

The Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) provides a portable printing layer for Linux, UNIX, and similar operating systems.
Security Fix(es):
* cups: heap based buffer overflow in libcups's ppdFindOption() in ppd-mark.c (CVE-2020-3898)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
Additional Changes:
For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.3 Release Notes linked from the References section.
